article.headline: Old Dominion 88, Longwood 56
article.story: NORFOLK, Va. (AP) -- Arnaud Dahi scored seven points in a 24-9 run late in the first half, and Old Dominion coasted to an 88-56 victory over Longwood on Monday night. Dahi started the run with a 3-pointer to give Old Dominion (10-1) a 23-13 lead with 11:16 remaining in the first half. He also scored on two layups as the Monarchs stretched the lead to 44-22 at the break. Longwood (1-12) could get no closer than 19 the rest of the way. The Lancers took an early 8-5 lead, but a pair of free throws by Drew Williamson and a dunk by Dahi put the Monarchs ahead to stay, 9-8, with 17:07 left in the first half. Isaiah Hunter led Old Dominion with 17 points. Valdas Vasylius added 15, Alex Loughton 12 and Dahi 11. Lamar Barrett was 5-of-6 from 3-point range and was the only Lancer in double figures with 17 points.
